title: Dark Mode?
text: Please? This is one of the few apps that I use multiple times per day, and I always forget about that shiny white background.

title: Hack My A***
text:
Hackers can’t use your phone info to get the codes. 
W/Iphone, you have to enter your passcode / Face before accessing Authenticator app - to get the new refresh codes. Triple extra security layer!

title: Terrible!!
text: I’ve had to use this app for both my school and work emails. Every time I have to verify my accounts through the app I end up having to call my organization IT because I do not receive notifications through the app. It is incredibly frustrating and time consuming!! I would rate this zero stars if possible. The app is worthless and does not function as it should.

title: Can’t sign in for help
text: Terrible app. I tried setting this up. Had issues signing in. Went to the customer support for help. It asked me to sign in before I can get a call from a Microsoft rep. So I can’t log in because I need the app but when you go to the customer support it wants you to talk to a stupid AI for direction then it asked you to sign in even though you went to the customer for help with signing in. Pure garbage app.

title: Went way downhill
text:
This app used to be awesome, but now it is the worst of my authenticating apps (duo, imprivata, etc.) Approval from watch has been broken for weeks. Also, I feel like I have to provide my thumbprint at least 2-3 times in the authentication workflow. Please hang onto my authentication and rest assured no one has snatched my phone in the .2 seconds since you last asked for my ttimbprint.

Overall, clunky and impedes my workflow.

title: Waste of time now
text:
What is the point of having this app when it no longer works on desktop? I used it to add a layer of security to my psychotherapy notes, so I can use both desktop and mobile. Thanks to Microsoft making yet another unfriendly move, this app is now pointless. 
Can anyone tell me why Microsoft creates a great thing only to ruin it immediately? It’s a pattern.

title: Quick and secure
text: Better than phone verification if traveling abroad and not being able to use US sim.

title: Looping issue
text:
PLEASE fix the looping issue. When setting up new accounts, you’ll receive a notice to open Authenticator. At that point, Authenticator tells you to open Authenticator, too. 

Horrible idea to include opening an already open app, as it won’t allow for codes to come through.

title: Microsoft continues to be an absolute nightmare
text:
Ms has found a new way to get between you and actually getting anything done. This obnoxious multi-step new insert into the already janky and invasive MS universe is sure to add headaches to your day to day, injecting multi-level authentication every time you try to open Word to write something.
No one asked for this, no one wants to hear from you, Microsoft.
Absolutely obnoxious.

title: Must Have app for Office 365 Users
text: I found out about this app on the Consumer Microsoft website! For uploading sensitive documents to the cloud, you must download this app to your phone to give you the security we deserve!

title: Need option for OneDrive backup
text: The MS Authenticator app works great, but we are forced to use iCloud as the only cloud backup option?  That’s fine, but we should have the option to use our Microsoft 365 OneDrive storage account.

title: Works fine!
text: Works great! Just make sure to back everything on the app with personal and then iCloud and then you will be good to go!

title: Authenticatior
text: I do not like this app. I had to use this app for work purposes. And now I find that it is all into my personal information so that when I go into my phone or laptop i have to verify it’s actually me. My darn passwords have even been changed and I am having the worst time removing this app from my devices…THINK CAREFULLY before you download this to your devices.

title: Authentication?
text: Need help! Can’t authenticate my company email in Outlook. Outlook says open the authentication app and enter the number shown but when I open the app there’s a number already in the app. I have tried on Windows, MacOS, and IOS, it’s always the same. Am I doing something wrong or is it a bug or a known issue. Please help.

title: Overheats Phone
text: If you accidentally leave the app open for more than 30 seconds, your phone will start to dramatically overheat. There is no reason why this app is written so poorly as to cause this overheating issue. If you check Reddit, you’ll see it’s an issue across multiple users and devices. #yikes

title: Microsoft makes it super hard to use
text: Could be my problem. I was trying to sign in my company email account into my phone. And, Microsoft just keep asking to improve the safety and not letting me to sign in. I just want to sign in, it took me 45 minutes and I still could not get my team sign in. It should freaking a less than 5 minutes process.

title: Two serious issues
text:
1. If you leave the application open your phone will heat up so much you won't be able to hold it. In 20 minutes it will drain 15% of your battery.

2. Face ID will either time out too quickly forcing you to unlock using PIN, or it will take a minute of you grimacing in front of the phone to unlock it.

title: User friendly
text: Easy to use safe and ready available what more can you ask for.

title: Apple Watch Version Please
text: Works as advertised.  It would be nice to have the ability to verify through the Apple Watch.

title: It’s not doing auto fill anymore!
text: Noticed after recent updates is not doing auto fill anymore. For sites and apps I click on password, Authenticator opens then closes quickly but doesn’t do the auto fill.  This has forced me to manually inlit passwords again…including opening Authenticator again to find them. Very disappointed!!!

title: I hate this thing
text: I can’t set up my account on my iPad because this stupid app keeps going in an endless circle of asking for passwords and then telling me to download the app (which I already have).  It never gives me the chance to enter the Authenticator codes into outlook.  And there is no-one to call for help, so I am stuck.  I wish my company had never gone to microsoft 365.

title: Needs a lot of work
text: It’s a good app to authorize any apps or people getting to your account. Unfortunately when you try to authorize it from your phone to your computer it doesn’t work at all. Had to change a bunch password cause it wasn’t authorize the user was me, or that the email was right so had to change that too. This app causes a lot of trouble for the user. Very disappointing

title: Fix Apple Watch Functionality
text: I used to be able to use the Apple Watch to approve Push notifications when logging in. After iOS 14 and watchOS 7 came out it no longer works. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling it on my Apple Watch, but it still doesn’t work right.

title: Typical Microsoft
text:
I don’t know why i even bother trying Microsoft apps, it’s always the same story.
The whole reason I installed this app is because it claimed to work on my watch. It turns out it only shows Microsoft only accounts. Why? You couldn’t pay enough to your developers, they only had time to add Microsoft accounts only? As usual, offers half of the functionality it claims and lack behind the competitors

title: Stupid hoops to jump through
text: I already have the authenticator but it made me go through a meaningless extra step to go through the app instead of just the camera or type in the numbers. I was also forced to enable push notifications which is absurd. It was working just fine before all of this as well.

title: Classical MS Big App and hard to use
text:
Like the title says, this guy takes the same size as my Outlook app and always giving errors and let me send the logs to MS. Different notifications fight with each other therefore seeing three popups at the same time I won’t surprised. And errors are like dead loop, never letting me a way out until swipe the app in iOS.

Good job Microsoft

title: Account access lost forever!! BEWARE
text: If your device is lost, stollen or hardware failure, and you haven’t manually transferred these accounts to a new device before it happens, you can NEVER access your accounts again! Never ever and there’s no work around. This would be a killer hack or prank, but never do this to yourself on purpose. Stay far far away from this app.

title: Will not work on Apple Watch
text: Always works when approving on iPhone, which is why the three stars. Get a message that it “Failed to communicate with phone” when trying to approve from Apple watch. Wish this would get resolved.

title: It’s too much fun setting up your computers
text: Like seriously it just tickles me to be railroaded and blocked from downloading Chrome. It makes me giddy to be forced to download your apps to use the inarguably better browser because you don’t want to count it as a verified app in S mode. I’m made jolly by your attempt to make me use your products and the actual five layers of hassle you have to stop me from using others

title: Annoying
text: I have to use this app because my school uses Office 365. It may improve security, but I need to open the app, identify myself, return to previous pages I was viewing, then I could complete the whole identification login process, which is annoying and a waste of time. Sometimes it doesn’t work, I need to refresh school login page and do the whole process again.

title: Missing Dark Mode
text: Otherwise near perfect app for my use case. Not sure why is it still missing a dark mode?

title: DEVICE CHANGE LOSES ALL DATA
text: Do not use this app at all costs. If you upgrade your phone, and restore from even an encrypted back up, none of the data from the Authenticator is saved in your new phone. You will be locked out of every single account you use this app for. This app is utter trash and Microsoft has zero support to help users who experience this issue.

title: Works for iPhone but not Apple Watch
text: After updating to Apple Watch iOS 8.0.1 the app has stop working with Apple Watch, this needs to be fix by Microsoft or Apple.

title: App is ineffective and is a pain to use
text:
Thank god for the genius in cyber security who protects me from hackers seeing my work schedule! 

I wish they never invented this. This app is so stupid and unnecessary. I can’t even check my work schedule because the app is stuck in a loop. I would erase this app from existence if I could. 

Make a better app it literally can’t fulfil the  simplest purpose ever. Terrible

title: Lost ALL my account info 😭😭😭
text:
I backed up my phone, switched to a new phone, and my account data is gone… all of it… unrecoverable and gone forever. 

I clicked the restore from backup and of course this doesn’t work. 

I have so many accounts I can never log into again… will never use another Microsoft security product as long as I live.

title: Terrible
text: Worked good until I got a new phone and data transferred... lost all my account information and now I've lost my snapchat account permanently with memories lost for good. No worse feeling than that from an app I though I could trust. Now I will never get some of my memories and pictures back. Truly disappointing. Never will use this app again.

title: Crashing on iphone SE
text: Used to love this app but it seems to be crashing after on iphone SE for about a week. Have to restart the iPhone every time.

title: Love it... better peace of mind!
text: In today’s world, you can’t be too careful with your passwords, personal details and payment info. I feel better safeguarded by having this extra layer of security.

title: Watch app is useless
text: I was very excited about the watch app. But it works 1 or 2 times out of 20 (maybe even more). The app on an iPhone works pretty good. Leaving only 2 stars for crappy watch app.

title: Not working anymore
text: So I got a new phone and when this app transferred over I lost my two step verification with Facebook. Lost my Facebook account of 11 years with all my photo albums on it. :/ devastated it’s like losing your photos to a fire as some of these were set to private. Unbelievable. Why didn’t my accounts transfer over? :(

title: Suggestion
text: Rather than simply have a countdown spinner, it would be more visually clear to have the number fade. In the last 10 seconds (or so), you could gradually make the number more transparent, meaning its expiring. Just a thought on how to be more human-centered:)

title: Works as advertised
text: We use this as MFA tool for logging onto our corporate network.  Flawless and much better than the old text codes as no network connection is needed

title: Just Makes Life Easy
text:
Easy cross platform so all your passwords are available across platforms!

A must have to avoid platform lock in!

title: Worked At One Point
text: I’ve been using this app for a year and a half now. It’s always been fine but the last two months it will send me into a spiral where it provides me a number but will not authenticate. This has resulted in me having to text the company I work for instead of email and it’s completely unprofessional

title: Old
text: This authentication app is old and doesn’t have the updated features that one like 2FAS has. If you’re looking for an authentication app look at the two FAS you’re gonna be so much happier. It’s so much easier to use and has functions that don’t make you have to type in the numbers every time, especially on your computer.

title: Middle of the Pack Authenticator
text: Duo mobile works much better and allows me to approve sign in from my Apple Watch. This app does not have this feature and sometimes takes a couple tries to get into my account, so it’s just okay.

userName: Josh Is A W A R
title: Destroys Google auth (:
text: Having Face ID before showing the codes makes this feel more secure than other options!! (:

title: Over Engineered
text: This is worthless and is nothing but a problem! I have to respond to work emails from home but can’t because this app randomly removed me from my email and as I set it up, I have to verify my information through this same app I am already trying to verify! Makes no sense just like this stupid app I have to use!

title: Get Better Support
text: I got a new phone and didn’t know that my old phone was needed to transfer my data from the app. I’m now locked out of my work email and everything for work from my home computer and Microsoft Support basically said oh well. They need to have a way to over ride all of this because now I have to go into my physical office and work during this pandemic!

title: iCloud backup doesn’t work
text: After having to rest my phone and redownload the app, I was unable to restore my app using the “iCloud backup feature” which I had selected. Every time I clicked the restore button it told me there was no backup. This has happened multiple times now causing me to have to restore a bunch of accounts I had linked this busted app. Thanks again Microsoft
